meanings.definition: Not able to be communicated or shared with others.
meanings.sent1: The feeling of loneliness was incommunicable to his friends.
meanings.sent2: Her sorrow was incommunicable, hidden behind a smile.
meanings.sent3: The cat's incommunicable expression made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset was incommunicable in words.
meanings.sent5: The mystery of the ancient ruins was incommunicable to the tourists.

meanings.sent1: The complexity of the concept was incommunicable to the students.
meanings.sent2: His emotions were incommunicable, buried deep within.
meanings.sent3: The incommunicable truth finally came to light.
meanings.sent4: The depth of her love was incommunicable but felt by all.
meanings.sent5: The magnitude of the disaster was incommunicable through words alone.
